The relevant table should be cross-referenced here - presumably Table 16. The table should also be placed in the relevant section, 3.4, and should include the language information somewhere, e.g. in the caption.

As a general point - tables are inconsistently formatted with regard to language information. Later tables such as this, with the language name, code and location in the caption, are more readable than the earlier tables which put this info in the table itself.

General comment: It is not clear to me why the article speaks of prosodic restructuring of *nominals*. Why not: prosodic restructuring of (or: in) noun phrases? Or: prosodic restructuring in nominal constructions?
The bracket following the year of publication is sometimes part of the reference hyperlink, sometimes not (see coloured vs. black colour of closing bracket). Check the whole chapter for consistency!
Here and in the remainder of the chapter: Use double quotation marks as 'scare quotes'. Single quotation marks should be restricted to English translations of Somali data.
